question: Who is the writer of this song that was inspired by words on a tombstone and was the first track on the box set Back to Mono?

title: Back to Mono (1958–1969)
Back to Mono (1958–1969)
To Know Him Is to Love Him

context_titles: To Know Him Is to Love Him

runs.question: Who is the writer of this song that was inspired by words on a tombstone and was the first track on the box set Back to Mono?

steps.thought: The question is asking for the writer of a specific song that was inspired by words on a tombstone and is the first track on the box set "Back to Mono." To answer this, I need to identify the song and its writer. I'll start by searching for the song details related to the "Back to Mono" box set.

action_input.query: first track on box set Back to Mono inspired by words on a tombstone

steps.observation: Found 10 relevant document(s): Trash Box, Chrome, Smoke & BBQ, Back to Mono (1958–1969), Live in Japan (John Coltrane album), Nashville Rebel (box set), Radiohead Box Set, Mono Masters, Led Zeppelin Boxed Set 2, To Know Him Is to Love Him, The Doors: Vinyl Box Set

steps.thought: The search results include a document titled "Back to Mono (1958–1969)" and another titled "To Know Him Is to Love Him," which seems likely to be related to the song in question. I should retrieve information from these documents to find the specific song and its writer.
steps.observation: Back to Mono (1958–1969) is a box set (4 compact discs or 5 vinyl LPs) compilation of the recorded work of record producer Phil Spector, through the 1960s, released in 1991 by ABKCO as #7118-2.  The first track, "To Know Him Is to Love Him," released in 1958, features Spector performing as part of the group the Teddy Bears.  Initially a vinyl album-sized package, the box contained a booklet with photographs, complete song lyrics, discographical information, and a reproduction of the essay on Spector by Tom Wolfe, "The First Tycoon of Teen."  The package also contained a small, round, red "Back to Mono" pin.

steps.thought: The first track on the "Back to Mono" box set is "To Know Him Is to Love Him," performed by the Teddy Bears. I should now confirm the writer of this song.

action_input.title: To Know Him Is to Love Him

steps.observation: "To Know Him Is to Love Him" is a song written by Phil Spector, inspired by words on his father's tombstone, "To Know Him Was To Love Him."  It was first recorded by the only vocal group of which he was a member, the Teddy Bears.  Their recording spent three weeks at No. 1 on the "Billboard" Hot 100 singles chart in 1958, while reaching No. 2 on UK's "New Musical Express" chart.  Peter & Gordon and Bobby Vinton later had hits with the song, with its title and lyrics changed to "To Know You Is to Love You".  In 1987, the song was resurrected by Dolly Parton, Linda Ronstadt and Emmylou Harris, whose "Trio" recording topped the U.S. country singles charts.  The song is in 12/8 time.

steps.thought: I have now confirmed the information needed to answer the question. The song "To Know Him Is to Love Him," which was inspired by words on a tombstone and is the first track on the box set "Back to Mono," was written by Phil Spector.

action_input.answer: The song 'To Know Him Is to Love Him' was written by Phil Spector.

steps.observation: Task completed. Final answer: The song 'To Know Him Is to Love Him' was written by Phil Spector.

runs.final_answer: The song 'To Know Him Is to Love Him' was written by Phil Spector.

The first track, "To Know Him Is to Love Him," released in 1958, features Spector performing as part of the group the Teddy Bears.  Initially a vinyl album-sized package, the box contained a booklet with photographs, complete song lyrics, discographical information, and a reproduction of the essay on Spector by Tom Wolfe, "The First Tycoon of Teen."  The package also contained a small, round, red "Back to Mono" pin.

steps.thought: I found a document specifically about the song "To Know Him Is to Love Him." I will retrieve it to find out who wrote the song.

action_input.title: To Know Him Is to Love Him

steps.observation: "To Know Him Is to Love Him" is a song written by Phil Spector, inspired by words on his father's tombstone, "To Know Him Was To Love Him."  It was first recorded by the only vocal group of which he was a member, the Teddy Bears.  Their recording spent three weeks at No. 1 on the "Billboard" Hot 100 singles chart in 1958, while reaching No. 2 on UK's "New Musical Express" chart.  Peter & Gordon and Bobby Vinton later had hits with the song, with its title and lyrics changed to "To Know You Is to Love You".  In 1987, the song was resurrected by Dolly Parton, Linda Ronstadt and Emmylou Harris, whose "Trio" recording topped the U.S. country singles charts.  The song is in 12/8 time.

steps.thought: I have found the information I was looking for. The song "To Know Him Is to Love Him," which was inspired by words on a tombstone and is the first track on the "Back to Mono" box set, was written by Phil Spector.

action_input.answer: The song 'To Know Him Is to Love Him' was written by Phil Spector.
